com.diogonunes.jcdp.bw.api

Interface IPrinter

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IColoredPrinter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractColoredPrinter, AbstractPrinter, ColoredPrinter, Printer, TerminalPrinter, UnixColoredPrinter, WindowsColoredPrinter

    public interface IPrinter
    Every class that implements this interface is called a Printer. A Printer must print normal, error and debug messages. It must offer a choice to print or not a timestamp before each of those messages. To print a message means that the message is written somewhere: a terminal, a file or something else. A Printer must have a level of debug and it acts like a visibility scope. A debug message may also have a debug level. If so, it means that the debug message should only be displayed if the Printer has enough level of debug, i.e. the Printer must have a level of debug equal of greater than the level of the message. By convention, if the Printer has a level of debug of zero than all debug messages should be printed.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void debugPrint(java.lang.Object msg)
      Prints a debug message to terminal.
      void debugPrint(java.lang.Object msg, int level)
      Prints a debug message to terminal if the printer has enough level of debug to print that message.

      Prints a debug message (with a newline at the end) to terminal.
      void debugPrintln(java.lang.Object msg, int level)

    • Method Detail

      • getLevel

        int getLevel()
        Returns:
        current level of debug.

      • setLevel

        void setLevel(int level)
        Changes the level of debug. This level represents the maximum level of the debug messages displayed by the printer.
        Parameters:
        level - The new level of debug (should be 0 or greater).

      • getDateTime

        java.lang.String getDateTime()
        Returns:
        the current date and time using some format specified by the class which implements this interface.

      • printTimestamp

        Prints current Time and Date.
